summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2021 between a Senior Paralegal at FedEx's Legal Department and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York. The correspondence concerns the identification of a FedEx records custodian to potentially testify or sign an affidavit for the upcoming trial of Ghislaine Maxwell, scheduled for November 2021 in New York. The emails reference a 2008 subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida related to FedEx records, likely connected to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the upcoming criminal trial in New York for which the FedEx records custodian testimony is being sought.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in a question from the FedEx paralegal asking if the case is 'the' Jeffrey Epstein case, confirming the context of the records request.

persons.name: Senior Paralegal
persons.role: Senior Paralegal, Federal Express Corporation Legal Department
persons.context: The FedEx employee corresponding with the AUSA, reviewing records, and offering to testify or sign an affidavit regarding FedEx records subpoenaed in 2008.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: The prosecutor from the SDNY who is seeking a FedEx records custodian to testify or sign an affidavit for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, referencing a 2008 subpoena from Florida.

connections.description: The document context implies the trial and records are related to the Epstein investigation, with Maxwell as the defendant.
Prosecutor from SDNY is coordinating with a FedEx legal department paralegal to secure a witness/affiant for the Maxwell trial.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Scheduled
events.description: The criminal trial for Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to start in New York in November 2021.

events.title: SD Florida Subpoena to FedEx
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida sent a subpoena to FedEx in February 2008 for records, likely as part of the earlier Epstein investigation.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors from the SDNY were, as of July 2021, seeking a FedEx records custodian to testify or sign an affidavit for the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
The records request is connected to a FedEx subpoena issued in February 2008 by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida, linking to the earlier Epstein investigation.
A FedEx paralegal explicitly asked if the case was related to 'the' Jeffrey Epstein, confirming the context of the legal request.
The email chain shows coordination between a federal prosecutor and corporate legal staff to secure evidence for a high-profile criminal trial.
